class pyxalign.options.options.GradientIntegrationUnwrapOptions(gradient_method: pyxalign.api.enums.ImageGradientMethods = <ImageGradientMethods.FOURIER_DIFFERENTIATION: 'fourier_differentiation'>, integration_method: pyxalign.api.enums.ImageIntegrationMethods = <ImageIntegrationMethods.FOURIER: 'fourier'>, fourier_shift_step: float = 0.5, use_masks: bool = True, deramp_polyfit_order: int = 1)[source]¶

Bases: object

deramp_polyfit_order: int = 1¶

The order of the polynomial fit used to de-ramp the phase

fourier_shift_step: float = 0.5¶

The finite-difference step size used to calculate the gradient, if the Fourier shift method is selected

gradient_method: ImageGradientMethods = 'fourier_differentiation'¶

The method used to calculate the phase gradient

integration_method: ImageIntegrationMethods = 'fourier'¶

The method used to integrate the image back from gradients

use_masks: bool = True¶

Determines if the projection masks should be multiplied with the projections before unwrapping

class pyxalign.options.options.IterativeResidualUnwrapOptions(iterations: int = 10, lsq_fit_ramp_removal: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: object

iterations: int = 10¶

Number of iterative correction steps to perform

lsq_fit_ramp_removal: bool = False¶

Whether to remove phase ramps using least-squares fitting after unwrapping

class pyxalign.options.options.Number[source]¶

Bases: object

All numbers inherit from this class.

If you just want to check if an argument x is a number, without caring what kind, use isinstance(x, Number).

class pyxalign.options.options.PhaseUnwrapOptions(device: pyxalign.api.options.device.DeviceOptions = <factory>, method: pyxalign.api.enums.PhaseUnwrapMethods = <PhaseUnwrapMethods.ITERATIVE_RESIDUAL_CORRECTION: 'iterative_residual_correction'>, gradient_integration: pyxalign.api.options.options.GradientIntegrationUnwrapOptions = <factory>, iterative_residual: pyxalign.api.options.options.IterativeResidualUnwrapOptions = <factory>)[source]¶

Bases: object

device: DeviceOptions¶
gradient_integration: GradientIntegrationUnwrapOptions¶

Options for GradientIntegration unwrapping

iterative_residual: IterativeResidualUnwrapOptions¶

Options for IterativeResidualCorrection unwrapping

method: PhaseUnwrapMethods = 'iterative_residual_correction'¶

Phase unwrapping method to use

Options: - PhaseUnwrapMethods.IterativeResidualCorrection

  • default choice; typically performs better

  • PhaseUnwrapMethods.GradientIntegration

    • can perform better if the IterativeResidualCorrection

    unwrapping is producing large phase ramps - same unwrapping method that is used by pty-chi

Bases: object

pyxalign.options.options.field(*, default=<dataclasses._MISSING_TYPE object>, default_factory=<dataclasses._MISSING_TYPE object>, init=True, repr=True, hash=None, compare=True, metadata=None, kw_only=<dataclasses._MISSING_TYPE object>)[source]¶

Return an object to identify dataclass fields.

default is the default value of the field. default_factory is a 0-argument function called to initialize a field’s value. If init is true, the field will be a parameter to the class’s __init__() function. If repr is true, the field will be included in the object’s repr(). If hash is true, the field will be included in the object’s hash(). If compare is true, the field will be used in comparison functions. metadata, if specified, must be a mapping which is stored but not otherwise examined by dataclass. If kw_only is true, the field will become a keyword-only parameter to __init__().

It is an error to specify both default and default_factory.

class pyxalign.options.options.partial(func, /, *args, **keywords)[source]¶

Bases: object

Create a new function with partial application of the given arguments and keywords.

args¶

tuple of arguments to future partial calls

func¶

function object to use in future partial calls

keywords¶

dictionary of keyword arguments to future partial calls

pyxalign.options.options.viridis() → None[source]¶

Set the colormap to ‘viridis’.

This changes the default colormap as well as the colormap of the current image if there is one. See help(colormaps) for more information.
